Constructor Detail

Formula

public Formula(int type,
               java.lang.String ident)
Constructor for atomic formulae (i.e. formulae without sub-formulae)

Parameters:
type - Identifier for the formula, one of the defined types
ident - Additional information. For proposition symbols this is the name of the symbol

Formula

public Formula(int type,
               Formula left,
               Formula right)
Constructor for binary operators (i.e. formulae with two sub-formulae)

Parameters:
type - Identifier for the formula, one of the defined types
left - Left sub-formula
right - right sub-formula

Formula

public Formula(int type,
               Formula sf)
Constructor for unary operators (i.e. neg)

Parameters:
sf - sub-formula

Formula

public Formula(int type,
               java.lang.String ident,
               Formula sf)
Constructor for modal and fixed-point operators they have one subformula and an additional identifier specifying the fixed-point variable or the label of the edge, in case of modal opertors. For instance, a formula \mu X.\phi would call this constructor with type mu, ident "X" and sf \phi. \phi would call this with type diamond, ident "a" and sf \phi.

Parameters:
type - Identifier for the formula, one of the defined types
sf - This parameter points to the sub-formula
ident - Additional information. For proposition symbols this is the name of the symbol

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

valid

public boolean valid()
checks whether the formula is valid, i.e. whether no least or greatest fixed-point variable is used negatively

Returns:
returns true if no variable is bound twice in the formula and no fixed-point variable is used negatively. Returns false otherwise.
